Aggregated weekly digest of all things Kubernetes.

View this email in your browser

KubeWeekly #17: Week of July 6th, 2015

 

Welcome to your curated newsletter, where we share the latest happenings in the Kubernetes ecosystem across vendor integrations, open source contributions, exciting announcements, blog content, events and more!


Last week was GopherCon in Denver with a great deal of excitement from the Go community and the announcement of the first conference fully dedicated to Kubernetes: KubeCon! We also saw the first v1.0.0 tagged release by Brendan Burns this week! Next week, we look forward to reporting back about all the exciting news from the official Kubernetes launch event!

Technical

V1.0.0 by Brendan Burns

Try Kubernetes with Vagrant (HN) by Christoph Hartmann

Set up Kubernetes with a Docker compose one-liner by Sebastien Goasguen

OpenContrail - Kubernetes Integration Demo {+ blog post} by OpenContrail

Gource Visualization of Kubernetes' Evolution by Landon Wilkins

Configure a Highly Available Kubernetes / etcd Cluster with Pacemaker on Fedora by Scott Collier

Articles

Kubernetes v1.0 now on GitHub, and KubeCon! by The New Stack

Containers and Clusters - Disrupting how cloud services are delivered by Chris Kleban

Top 5 Tools To Improve Your Docker Workflow by Site24x7

Presentations

Cluster management, cognitive shifts, & kubernetes (+ audience notes) by Julia Ferraioli

Events This Week

July 15th: The Colorado Springs Open Source Software Meetup Group Monthly Meetup in Colorado

July 16th: Conteneurisez votre poste de Dev + Orchestrez avec Kubernetes in Marseille, France

July 19th: Docker & Kubernetes 技术沙龙 in Beijing
